title: Apple Car will cost $55,000, say analysts | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Apple
Carplay](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**If previous Apple products are anything to go by, we’d expect an[Apple
Car](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/apple-car-news-rumours-driverless-
price-release-date-electric) to cost a pretty penny.**

How pretty exactly? Somewhere in the region of $55,000, or £36,000, according
to a group of technology analysts, as reported by
[Alphr](http://www.alphr.com/cars/1001750/apple-car-price-revealed-will-
project-titan-cost-55000).

Jefferies and Co. estimated how much Apple might charge customers to drive its
long-rumoured electric vehicle.

The educated guess is detailed in a 68-page report produced by the company,
revealing the hefty sum as an average price.

The report suggests that Apple’s car will actually be available in several
different variants, all with different price points.

While it might sound expensive right now – the BMW i3 starts at $42,400 – the
Apple Car isn’t expected to go on sale until at least 2020, if it even exists.

Jefferies and Co. also predicts that Apple will sell at least 200,000 units of
its first vehicle.

That’s significantly more than the 55,000 vehicles that Tesla is expected to
sell in 2015.

Tesla CEO [Elon Musk hit out at
Apple](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/elon-musk-apple-hires-tesla-
rejects) earlier this month, publicly ridiculing the company’s prospective
efforts in the car space.

When asked if Tesla was worried about Apple’s recent hiring of its own
important engineers, Musk responded: “Important engineers? They have hired
people we’ve fired. We always jokingly call Apple the ‘Tesla Graveyard’. If
you don’t make it at Tesla, you go work at Apple. I’m not kidding.”

**Related:[Apple Car: The biggest challenges Apple
faces](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinions/apple-car-features)**

However, he soon attempted to soothe relations,
[tweeting](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/elon-musk-apple-twitter-hate):
“Yo, I don’t hate Apple. It’s a great company with a lot of talented people. I
love their products and I’m glad they’re doing an EV.”
